products.name: No. 140 Iron Skew Block Plane - Left
descriptions: The 1-1/2" wide x 1/8" thick blade has an 18° skew and is bedded at 12° with a captive nut for positive and accurate adjusting.

products.name: No. 51 Shoot Board Plane - Left Hand
Bronze Beading Tool and Blade Set
Cabinet Maker's Scraper
descriptions: This elegant Scraping Plane, comfortably sized between our large and small Scraping Planes, is based on the Stanley No. 85. The blade extends the full width of the base and allows you to work  right into a corner, such as a fielded panel. The tilting knob and handle offer clearance for your knuckles when scraping inside a box or on a wide, deep rabbet. Frog is fixed.

products.name: Boggs Flat Spokeshave
descriptions: The original Boggs Spokeshave is hefty and solid, weighing 12 oz. Designed for fine, precise shaping in all woods. Available with either a flat or curved sole.

products.name: Rabbet Block Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 60-1/2 Rabbet Block Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: No. 1 Bench Plane Blade, 1-3/16"
descriptions: Replacement blade for Lie-Nielsen No. 1 Bench Plane. A2 Steel, cryogenically treated, hardened to Rockwell 60-62 and double tempered. Our heat treating technique ensures that the blade will take and hold a very fine edge for a long time. After heat treating, the blade is fully surface ground on the top, back, and cutting edge, giving a smooth, flat surface that will take a mirror finish very quickly. Our blades are thick to provide solid, chatter-free cutting.

products.name: Model Maker's Block Plane
descriptions: This delightful, small tool fits snugly in the palm of your hand. It is a miniature work-horse — ideal for all sorts of chamfering and trimming jobs. Overall length, including the squirrel-tail handle, is 4-7/8".  The sole is 1-1/4" wide x 3-1/2" long.
Ductile Iron body, Bronze cap.

products.name: Standard Chisel Handle
descriptions: Standard size handle for all but our largest chisels.  Made from Hard Maple.

We used Maine grown Hornbeam for many years but, unfortunately, we  are no longer able to secure a steady supply. So, we are now offering chisels  with Hard Maple handles, which is very tough and a suitable substitute. If  we’re able to acquire acceptable Hornbeam in the future, we’ll offer  replacement handles in Hornbeam.

products.name: Countersink
descriptions: Handy chamfering tool with an 82° countersink. Cherry handle.

products.name: Adjustable Mouth Block Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 60-1/2 Adjustable Mouth Block Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: Low Angle Smoothing Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 164 Low Angle Smooth Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: Large Scraping Plane
descriptions: An excellent tool for putting the final finish on large surfaces, especially when using woods that are difficult to finish with a Smoothing Plane. Our Large Scraping Plane is based on the Stanley No. 112, which was in production from 1885 to 1944. The blade, beveled at 45°, can be precisely adjusted to take the finest of shavings. The sole is ground dead flat.

products.name: No. 2 Bench Plane Blade, 1-5/8"
descriptions: Replacement blade for Lie-Nielsen No. 2 Bench Plane. A2 Steel, Cryogenically treated, hardened to Rockwell 60-62 and double tempered. Our heat treating technique ensures that the blade will take and hold a very fine edge for a long time. After heat treating, the blade is fully surface ground on the top, back, and cutting edge, giving a smooth, flat surface that will take a mirror finish very quickly. Our blades are thick to provide solid, chatter-free cutting.

products.name: No. 4 or 5 Bench Plane Blade, 2"
descriptions: Replacement blade for Lie-Nielsen No. 4 or 5 Bench Planes. A2 Steel, Cryogenically treated, hardened to Rockwell 60-62 and double tempered. Our heat treating technique ensures that the blade will take and hold a very fine edge for a long time. After heat treating, the blade is fully surface ground on the top, back, and cutting edge, giving a smooth, flat surface that will take a mirror finish very quickly. Our blades are thick to provide solid, chatter-free cutting.

products.name: Adjustable Mouth Block Plane - Grooved
descriptions: Based on the Stanley No. 60½, this versatile plane is useful for every sort of woodworking job and a pleasure to use.
The movable shoe in front of the blade allows you to easily and precisely adjust the mouth opening: fine mouth for finishing work and thin shavings, or ample opening for rank cuts.

Ductile Iron body is surface ground flat and square to a tolerance of .001" or better. Large, comfortable Bronze cap is tensioned with a 1-1/2" Brass spinwheel. Like our other block planes, the blade is adjusted with a captive nut for precise control with minimal backlash.
The blade is bedded at 12º for fine cuts and end grain work. Weight 1.5 lbs.

products.name: Adjustable Mouth Block Plane Blade, Toothed
descriptions: Toothed blades have small chisel-like teeth .030" (.762mm) wide, and spaced .030" apart. They are used for heavy stock removal in difficult grain. Follow with a fine-set Smoothing Plane.

Please Note: Toothed blades are great for quick, heavy stock removal. However, something like a knot in pine can break the teeth so be careful around difficult spots. We recommend that you hone your toothed blade with a secondary bevel at of 30 degrees or higher depending on the type of wood you are planing.

products.name: No. 3 Bench Plane Blade, 1-3/4"
descriptions: Replacement blade for Lie-Nielsen No. 3 Bench Plane. A2 Steel, Cryogenically treated, hardened to Rockwell 60-62 and double tempered. Our heat treating technique ensures that the blade will take and hold a very fine edge for a long time. After heat treating, the blade is fully surface ground on the top, back, and cutting edge, giving a smooth, flat surface that will take a mirror finish very quickly. Our blades are thick to provide solid, chatter-free cutting.

products.name: No. 140 Skew Block Plane - Right
descriptions: Based on the long unavailable Stanley 140, this multi-talented tool is designed to deal with difficult woods using a combination of a low angle approach, shear cutting action from the skewed and tilted blade, and extra weight of the bronze body.
A retractable nicker scores cross-grain fibers, and the removable side plate and adjustable fence allow quick conversion to rabbeting and cross-grain work, such as fielding raised panels.

Available in a left and right version for occasions when you need to approach the wood grain from the opposite direction. The removable face plate is on the left side of the "left" version of the tool, and the right side of the "right" version.
The 1-1/2" wide x 1/8" thick blade has an 18° skew and is bedded at 12° with a captive nut for positive and accurate adjusting.

products.name: Low Angle Jointer Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 7-1/2 Low Angle Jointer Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: No. 4-1/2, 5-1/2, 6 or 7 Bench Plane Blade, 2-3/8"
descriptions: Replacement blade for Lie-Nielsen No. 4-1/2, 5-1/2, 6 or 7 Bench Planes. A2 Steel, Cryogenically treated, hardened to Rockwell 60-62 and double tempered. Our heat treating technique ensures that the blade will take and hold a very fine edge for a long time. After heat treating, the blade is fully surface ground on the top, back, and cutting edge, giving a smooth, flat surface that will take a mirror finish very quickly. Our blades are thick to provide solid, chatter-free cutting.

products.name: Iron No. 102  Low Angle Block Plane w/ White Bronze Cap
descriptions: Limited edition Iron No. 102 Low Angle Block Plane with White Bronze cap. The Iron version of this useful tool has not been made in several years, and we are pleased to offer a small batch complete with a beautiful White Bronze cap.
Based on the Stanley No. 102, this small plane fits perfectly in the hand, slips easily into the pocket, and is destined to become the most useful tool in your workshop.
The blade is 1/8" thick for chatter-free cuts and the unobtrusive Stainless Steel adjuster offers blade control of micrometer ease and precision with minimum backlash.
5¼" long. Blade is 1¼" wide x 1/8" thick, bedded at 12° for fine cuts and end grain. Iron body, 15 oz.

products.name: Boggs Curved Spokeshave
descriptions: The original Boggs Spokeshave is hefty and solid, weighing 12 oz. Designed for fine, precise shaping in all woods. Available with either a flat or curved sole.

products.name: Long Chisel Handle
descriptions: Long Chisel Handles are 4" longer than our standard handles. Total length is 7.5", approximate usable length is 7". Excellent for paring. Made from Hard Maple.

products.name: Boggs Concave Spokeshave
descriptions: A collaboration between Master Chair Maker Brian Boggs and Lie-Nielsen Toolworks. A 2-5/8" diameter sole makes the Boggs Concave Spokeshave the right choice for working chair spindles and other round parts.

products.name: Small Bronze Spokeshave - Curved
descriptions: This Spokeshave is based on a tool that hasn’t been available since Edward Preston and Sons went out of business in the 1930’s. Lightweight but solid.  Redesigned for fine, precise shaping work in all woods. Available with a flat or curved sole (1-1/2" radius).

products.name: Small Bronze Spokeshave - Flat
descriptions: This Spokeshave is based on a tool that hasn’t been available since Edward Preston and Sons went out of business in the 1930’s. Lightweight but solid.  Redesigned for fine, precise shaping work in all woods. Available with a flat or curved sole (1-1/2" radius).

products.name: Low Angle Jack Rabbet Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 610 Low Angle Jack Rabbet Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: No. 140 Skew Block Plane Blade - Left
descriptions: Replacement blade for the Left version of our No. 140 Skew Block Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: No. 8 Bench Plane Blade, 2-5/8"
descriptions: Replacement blade for Lie-Nielsen No. 8 Bench Plane. A2 Steel, Cryogenically treated, hardened to Rockwell 60-62 and double tempered. Our heat treating technique ensures that the blade will take and hold a very fine edge for a long time. After heat treating, the blade is fully surface ground on the top, back, and cutting edge, giving a smooth, flat surface that will take a mirror finish very quickly. Our blades are thick to provide solid, chatter-free cutting.

products.name: No. 140 Skew Block Plane Blade - Right
descriptions: Replacement blade for the Right version of our No. 140 Skew Block Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: No. 2 Chipbreaker, 1-5/8"
descriptions: Fits Lie-Nielsen No. 2 Bench Planes. Lie-Nielsen chipbreakers are designed specifically for our tools. It is possible that they may fit some original Stanley or Record planes, but critical dimensions of these and other maker's tools varied over the years.

Our chipbreakers are made of High Carbon Tool Steel and are 1/8" thick with a .015" lip ground at a 2 degree angle to provide excellent contact between the leading edge of the chipbreaker and the blade. Very solid. Supplied with the chipbreaker screw.

products.name: No. 164 Low Angle Smooth Plane
descriptions: This compact, low-angle plane is capable of fine smoothing cuts or rapid stock removal and copes easily with end grain and knotty wood. Based on the rare Stanley 164, it is essentially a low angle version of the No. 4 Smooth Plane and a shorter version of the Low Angle Jack. The adjustable mouth and the unique, overhead, Bailey-type blade adjuster allow smooth adjustment of the cutting depth, even while planing.

products.name: Bronze Edge Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 95 Edge Planes. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: No. 8 Chipbreaker, 2-5/8"
descriptions: Fits Lie-Nielsen No. 8 Jointer Planes. Lie-Nielsen chipbreakers are designed specifically for our tools. It is possible that they may fit some original Stanley or Record planes, but critical dimensions of these and other maker's tools varied over the years.

Our chipbreakers are made of High Carbon Tool Steel and are 1/8" thick with a .015" lip ground at a 2 degree angle to provide excellent contact between the leading edge of the chipbreaker and the blade. Very solid. Supplied with the chipbreaker screw.

products.name: Convex Sole Block Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 100-1/2 Convex Sole Block Plane. Comes ground with a 7/8" radius.

products.name: No. 1 Chipbreaker, 1-3/16"
descriptions: Fits Lie-Nielsen No. 1 Bench Planes. Lie-Nielsen chipbreakers are designed specifically for our tools. It is possible that they may fit some original Stanley or Record planes, but critical dimensions of these and other maker's tools varied over the years.

Our chipbreakers are made of High Carbon Tool Steel and are 1/8" thick with a .015" lip ground at a 2 degree angle to provide excellent contact between the leading edge of the chipbreaker and the blade. Very solid. Supplied with the chipbreaker screw.

products.name: No. 4 Bronze Smooth Plane
descriptions: This is the standard-size smoothing plane. After other planes have done the prep work, it will take the finest shavings from the most difficult woods to leave you with a finished surface.

products.name: Violin Maker's Plane Blade, Toothed
descriptions: Toothed blade for our No. 101 Violin Maker's Block Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

Please Note: Toothed blades are great for quick, heavy stock removal. However, something like a knot in pine can break the teeth so be careful around difficult spots. We recommend that you hone your toothed blade with a secondary bevel at of 30 degrees or higher depending on the type of wood you are planing.

products.name: Tite-Mark Extensions
descriptions: A set of two shaft extensions: 3" and 6". Use individually or joined together to extend the reach of the Tite-Mark an extra 9".
Precisely made by Glen-Drake Toolworks in California.

products.name: O-1 Steel, 5/8" Bevel Edge Chisel
descriptions: Our chisels are based on the Stanley 750 Bevel Edge Socket Chisels. Socket chisels are not common these days, perhaps because they are expensive to make, but Stanley and others once produced these chisels in a vast array. Socket chisel handles are less likely to break than tang chisels, and can be replaced easily. Comfortable in the hand and with excellent balance.

products.name: Boggs Flat or Curved Sole Spokeshave Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our Curved or Flat Sole Boggs Spokeshaves. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: No. 4 or 5 Chipbreaker, 2"
descriptions: Fits Lie-Nielsen No. 4 or 5 Bench Planes. Lie-Nielsen chipbreakers are designed specifically for our tools. It is possible that they may fit some original Stanley or Record planes, but critical dimensions of these and other maker's tools varied over the years.

Our chipbreakers are made of High Carbon Tool Steel and are 1/8" thick with a .015" lip ground at a 2 degree angle to provide excellent contact between the leading edge of the chipbreaker and the blade. Very solid. Supplied with the chipbreaker screw.

products.name: No. 60-1/2 Rabbet Block Plane with Nicker
descriptions: Ideal for cutting small rabbets or trimming tenons to fit. Based on the Sargent No. 507, this low angle, fixed-mouth block plane has open sides with a blade that extends the full width of the body. It’s a great design, handy as a block plane and wider than most rabbet planes, making it easy to trim tenons to fit.

When set to cut, two circular A2 nickers protrude .010" on each side for scoring cross-grain cuts. The low angle of 12º makes it an excellent choice for end grain. Unbreakable Ductile Iron body ground flat and square to .001". Bronze cap.

products.name: Small Bronze Spokeshave Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our Flat or Curved Sole Small Bronze Spokeshaves. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: Bench Rabbet Plane Chipbreaker
descriptions: Fits Lie-Nielsen No. 10-1/4 Bench Rabbet Planes. Lie-Nielsen chipbreakers are designed specifically for our tools. It is possible that they may fit some original Stanley or Record planes, but critical dimensions of these and other maker's tools varied over the years.

Our chipbreakers are made of High Carbon Tool Steel and are 1/8" thick with a .015" lip ground at a 2 degree angle to provide excellent contact between the leading edge of the chipbreaker and the blade. Very solid. Supplied with the chipbreaker screw.

products.name: Medium Shoulder Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 042 Medium Shoulder Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: Grobet Auger Bit File
descriptions: Auger bit files are double ended, with  one end having teeth cut along the face with uncut edges, and the other with teeth cut along the edge and uncut faces.
This version, made by Grobet in Italy is well made, with each end of the file tapered in two dimensions, and a finely shaped center section to grip when working.

products.name: Saw Filing Practice Plates (5 pack)
descriptions: Saw sharpening takes practice. Rather than take your first passes with a file to your Lie-Nielsen Saws, warm up on these Practice Plates. Each plate is made from the same quality Swedish Steel used in our Dovetail and Carcass Saws, with 7ppi on one edge, and 13 ppi on the opposite. Sold in packs of five.

products.name: Small Shoulder Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 041 Small Shoulder Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: Tite-Mark Marking Blade
descriptions: All Tite-Marks come with an A2 Steel marking blade. That means it will take a very keen edge and be tough enough to hold it with minimal maintenance and normal use. Hone the flat side of it occasionally and it will last a long time. The blades can be damaged however, so having a spare blade around is not a bad idea.
Precisely made by Glen-Drake Toolworks in California.

products.name: Lie-Nielsen Notecards
descriptions: Variety pack of ten notecards and envelopes.  Each card is beautifully printed on the front, blank on the inside, and measures 5-1/2" x 4-1/4".

products.name: Small Scraping Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 212 Small Scraping Plane. The blade is double tempered A2 Tool Steel, hardened to Rockwell 60-62. Our heat treating technique ensures that the blade will take and hold a very fine edge for a long time. After heat treating, the blade is fully surface ground on the top, back, and cutting edge, giving a smooth, flat surface that will take a mirror finish very quickly. The 1/8" thickness provides solid chatter-free cutting.

products.name: Tite-Mark Adjustable Mortise Blade
descriptions: You can lay out a half-inch-or-over mortise and tenon using two adjustable mortise blades. For mortise and tenons less than one-half inch, we recommend our set of four fixed-width mortise blades.
Precisely made by Glen-Drake Toolworks in California.

products.name: O-1 Steel, 5/16" Bevel Edge Chisel
descriptions: Our chisels are based on the Stanley 750 Bevel Edge Socket Chisels. Socket chisels are not common these days, perhaps because they are expensive to make, but Stanley and others once produced these chisels in a vast array. Socket chisel handles are less likely to break than tang chisels, and can be replaced easily. Comfortable in the hand and with excellent balance.

products.name: Violin Maker's Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 101 Violin Maker's Block Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: Tite-Mark
descriptions: The heart of the Tite-Mark is its micro-adjustable fence. Slide the fence close, secure the tail, and then micro-adjust the head until it is right on your mark. The fence gives you precise, repeatable settings, and the A-2 tool steel blade gives you sharp, crisp lines.

Optional cutters include a set of mortise blades for laying out mortises and a scoring blade. In addition to the adjustable mortise blades  available for the Tite-Mark, we offer four fixed-width, double-bevel, mortise blades conveniently sized at 1/2", 3/8", 5/16" and 1/4".
Precisely made by Glen-Drake Toolworks in California.

products.name: SD-1 Nicker Screwdriver
descriptions: The SD-1 Nicker Screwdriver is made to fit the slotted screw securing the old style knife nickers on our No. 10-1/4 Bench Rabbet Plane (from 2018 or earlier).

They may be useful for other jobs as well. Modeled after gunsmith's screwdrivers with machined tips, correctly sized to fit the screw slots, giving you good power and control, without slipping. Blades are 4140 Steel. Cherry handles.

products.name: Scrub Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 40-1/2 Scrub Plane. Comes ground with a 3" radius.

products.name: Tite-Mark Adjustable Mortise Blade Set
descriptions: This set contains two Single Bevel Adjustable Mortise Blades.
You can lay out a mortise and tenon 1/2" or larger using two adjustable mortise blades. For mortise and tenons less than 1/2", we recommend our set of four fixed-width mortise blades.
Precisely made by Glen-Drake Toolworks in California.

products.name: No. 212 Small Scraping Plane, Iron, Grooved
descriptions: This unusual plane is based on the now scarce Stanley No. 212, which was discontinued in 1934 and bring high prices from today's collectors. We are pleased to make it available for woodworkers once again.

The almost perpendicular blade makes it ideal for small scraping jobs, producing shavings like the finest lace and leaving smooth surfaces with crisp edges. The blade angle can be adjusted from 75° to 100°, enabling it to be set up just right for the particular wood being worked.

It is a favorite among fly rod makers for thicknessing bamboo fly rod sections. This model comes with a Fly Rod Maker’s Groove, ground 1" wide x .003" deep into the sole of the plane, making it the perfect companion tool to a rod maker's form.

products.name: Boggs Concave Spokeshave Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our Concave Sole Boggs Spokeshave.

products.name: Beading Tool Blade Blanks
descriptions: Set of 5 blanks. Work with files to create your own shapes. This makes quick work of reproducing small pieces of molding for repair or restoration. Unhardened A-2 tool steel.  2-1/4" long, 5/8" wide, 1/16" thick.

products.name: No. 4 Smooth Plane, Iron
descriptions: This is the standard-size smoothing plane. After other planes have done the prep work, it will take the finest shavings from the most difficult woods to leave you with a finished surface.

products.name: Large Scraping Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 112 Large Scraping Plane. A2 Tool Steel hardened to Rockwell 60-62, cryogenically treated and double tempered. Our heat treating technique ensures that the blade will take and hold a very fine edge for a long time. After heat treating, the blade is fully surface ground on the top, back, and cutting edge, giving a smooth, flat surface that will take a mirror finish very quickly.

products.name: No. 4-1/2, 5-1/2, 6 or 7 Chipbreaker, 2-3/8"
descriptions: Fits Lie-Nielsen No. 4-1/2, 5-1/2, 6 and 7 Bench Planes. Lie-Nielsen chipbreakers are designed specifically for our tools. It is possible that they may fit some original Stanley or Record planes, but critical dimensions of these and other maker's tools varied over the years.

Our chipbreakers are made of High Carbon Tool Steel and are 1/8" thick with a .015" lip ground at a 2 degree angle to provide excellent contact between the leading edge of the chipbreaker and the blade. Very solid. Supplied with the chipbreaker screw.

products.name: No. 60-1/2 Adjustable Mouth Block Plane
descriptions: Based on the Stanley No. 60½, this versatile plane is useful for every sort of woodworking job and a pleasure to use.
The movable shoe in front of the blade allows you to easily and precisely adjust the mouth opening: fine mouth for finishing work and thin shavings, or ample opening for rank cuts.

Ductile Iron body is surface ground flat and square to a tolerance of .001" or better. Large, comfortable Bronze cap is tensioned with a 1-1/2" Brass spinwheel. Like our other block planes, the blade is adjusted with a captive nut for precise control with minimal backlash.
The blade is bedded at 12º for fine cuts and end grain work. Weight 1.5 lbs.

products.name: Large Shoulder Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 073 Large Shoulder Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: Tite-Mark Long
descriptions: The heart of the Tite-Mark is its micro-adjustable fence. Slide the fence close, secure the tail, and then micro-adjust the head until it is right on your mark. The fence gives you precise, repeatable settings, and the A-2 tool steel blade gives you  sharp, crisp lines.

Optional cutters include a set of mortise blades for laying out mortises and a scoring blade. In addition to the adjustable mortise blades available for the Tite-Mark, we offer four fixed-width, double-bevel, mortise blades conveniently sized at ½", 3/8", 5/16" and ¼".
Precisely made by Glen-Drake Toolworks in California.

products.name: O-1 Steel, 7/16" Bevel Edge Chisel
descriptions: Our chisels are based on the Stanley 750 Bevel Edge Socket Chisels. Socket chisels are not common these days, perhaps because they are expensive to make, but Stanley and others once produced these chisels in a vast array. Socket chisel handles are less likely to break than tang chisels, and can be replaced easily. Comfortable in the hand and with excellent balance.

products.name: Model Maker's Block Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 100 Model Maker's Block Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: Large Chisel Handle
descriptions: Infused Maple handle made to fit our 1-1/2" Bevel Edge Chisel.
Overall length is 6-1/4", length from socket to end is 5", diameter is 1-1/4".

products.name: Large Router Plane Blade Adapter
descriptions: Optional Blade Adapter for using our Small Router Plane Blades in the Large Router Plane. Blades sold separately.

products.name: Beading Tool Blade Set
descriptions: Seven hardened, double-ended blades will make 14 standard shapes. The blades will fit antique Stanleys as well, for those who have or acquire one without blades. Made from A2 Tool Steel, 5/8" (1.58cm) wide.
The blade profiles include:

products.name: No. 3 Bench Plane, Bronze
descriptions: The lighter weight and smaller size of this otherwise fully-fledged Smoother make it a popular tool for young apprentices, small work, and situations in which single-handed operation is necessary. The short body makes this an effective smoother for touching up local trouble spots.

products.name: Cabinet Maker's Scraping Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 85 Cabinet Maker's Scraper. A2 Tool Steel hardened to Rockwell 60-62, cryogenically treated and double tempered. Our heat treating technique ensures that the blade will take and hold a very fine edge for a long time. After heat treating, the blade is fully surface ground on the top, back, and cutting edge, giving a smooth, flat surface that will take a mirror finish very quickly.

products.name: Panel Gauge Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our Panel Gauge. Single bevel V-cutter.

products.name: Large Router Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 71 Large Router Plane.

products.name: Butt Mortise Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 40B Butt Mortise Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: No. 101 Violin Maker's Plane
descriptions: Our Violin Maker's Block Plane is perfect for detail-oriented jobs like instrument building or model making. Loosely based on the Stanely No. 101, it is the smallest of our hand planes to feature a captive nut blade adjuster for precisely controlled depth of cut. Body and cap are Manganese Bronze for extra weight, durability, and resistance to rust.

products.name: Carbide Burnisher
descriptions: Creating a burr on a scraper requires a hard, highly polished surface. Our Carbide Burnishers have a 1/4" diameter and 4" long polished solid Carbide shank held in a Cherry handle. A flared Brass bolster protects your fingers while burnishing.

products.name: No. 102 Low Angle Block Plane
descriptions: Based on the Stanley No. 102, this small plane fits perfectly in the hand, slips easily into the pocket, and is destined to become the most useful tool in your workshop.
The blade is 1/8" thick for chatter-free cuts and the unobtrusive Stainless Steel adjuster offers blade control of micrometer ease and precision with minimum backlash.

products.name: Small Chisel Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 97-1/2 Small Chisel Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: No. 3 Chipbreaker, 1-3/4"
descriptions: Fits Lie-Nielsen No. 3 Bench Planes. Lie-Nielsen chipbreakers are designed specifically for our tools. It is possible that they may fit some original Stanley or Record planes, but critical dimensions of these and other maker's tools varied over the years.

Our chipbreakers are made of High Carbon Tool Steel and are 1/8" thick with a .015" lip ground at a 2 degree angle to provide excellent contact between the leading edge of the chipbreaker and the blade. Very solid. Supplied with the chipbreaker screw.

products.name: Small Router Plane Depth Stop
descriptions: Brass depth stop makes it easy to cut predetermined depth repeatedly.

Use the depth stop to cut to a specific depth. Set the blade to the finish depth, then set the stop all the way down and tighten the thumbscrew on the stop. Then raise the blade back up to take your first shaving. Advance your depth of cut incrementally until the depth stop prevents you from going deeper.

products.name: No. 10-1/4 Bench Rabbet Plane
descriptions: Also known as a Carriage Maker’s or Jack Rabbet Plane, this is the largest rabbet plane made.  Based on the Stanley 10¼, which went out of production in the mid-1940s, we modified the design to fit the Bedrock format.  Adjustable side nickers make clean, cross-grain cuts.  Both handle and knob can tilt left or right to give better access and control in tight corners.

products.name: Hot Dog for the Low Angle Jack Plane
descriptions: This powder-coated Aluminum 'Hot Dog' attaches to the side of the No. 62 Low Angle Jack Plane to make shooting more comfortable.

products.name: No. 102 Low Angle Block Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 102 Low Angle Block Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: Rabbeting Plane Iron Blank, 3/4"
descriptions: Rabbeting Plane Iron Blanks (O1 Tool Steel, unhardened), with the tang centered, are for creating traditional rabbeting planes. All are 8" (20.32cm) long, have a bit length of 2-3/16" (5.55cm) and are tapered from 1/8" (3.17mm) to 1/16" (1.58mm) over the total length of the blade.

products.name: 1/4" Mortise Chisel
descriptions: Designed with cabinetmaking in mind, not timber framing, these well-balanced Mortise Chisels are ground with parallel sides and are taller than they are wide to help keep them straight in the cut.

products.name: 3/8" Mortise Chisel
descriptions: Designed with cabinetmaking in mind, not timber framing, these well-balanced Mortise Chisels are ground with parallel sides and are taller than they are wide to help keep them straight in the cut.

products.name: No. 1 Bench Plane, Iron
descriptions: Based on the famous Stanley No. 1, this miniature Bench Plane handles like a block plane and is wonderfully suitable for fine detail work and final touches.

products.name: No. 8 Jointer Plane
descriptions: The longest and heaviest of the bench planes, the No. 8 will flatten and true like no other. It is capable of precise joints and perfect flatness of large areas.

products.name: No. 140 Iron Skew Block Plane - Right
descriptions: The 1-1/2" wide x 1/8" thick blade has an 18° skew and is bedded at 12° with a captive nut for positive and accurate adjusting.

products.name: Large Router Plane - Closed Throat
descriptions: Router Planes are essential for any work that requires precise depth cuts, such as mortises, tenons, hinge gains, inlay, door locks, and the like.

Loosely based on the Stanley No. 71, our Large Router Planes feature an improved Brass depth stop and Stainless Steel blade adjuster for precise control of cutting depth. The included fence can be mounted on either side of the blade and flipped around for straight or curved cuts.

We make both Open and Closed throat versions of our Large Router Planes. The Open Throat design offers more visibility in front of the tool, which is especially useful for inlay work. The Closed Throat design gives more support in front of the blade, making it ideal for working on the edges of boards or cleaning out the end of a stopped groove in a rail or stile.

Our Router Planes have square blades, held solidly in square broached holes. This prevents the blade from slipping or twisting when removing large shavings or during diagonal use. The blade can also be mounted to face the back of the plane to work closer into corners.

products.name: Iron Beading Tool and Blade Set
No. 4 or 5 Bench Plane Roughing Blade
descriptions: Our 2" Cambered Blade is intended for roughing projects with the No. 4 or No. 5 Bench Planes.

products.name: No. 2 Bench Plane, Iron
descriptions: Based on the Stanley Bedrock design, this small smoother is useful where a light, compact, bench plane with a 45° pitch is more effective than a block plane.

products.name: No. 3 Bench Plane, Iron
descriptions: The lighter weight and smaller size of this otherwise fully-fledged Smoother makes this an effective smoother for touching up local trouble spots.

products.name: Brass Cross Peen Hammer
descriptions: This small hammer is not only great for tacks and brads, but also for making fine blade adjustments on your planes.

products.name: Langsner Froe
descriptions: Froes are L-shaped tools used in combination with mallets and wedges to rive green wood along the grain with more precision and finesse than an axe or maul. They are used to make planks, chair parts, tool handles, shingles, basket splints, blanks for spoon carving, and more.  Lie-Nielsen Froes are designed by green wood            riving expert, Drew Langsner. Having split and rived stock for decades, Drew redesigned this traditional            tool with several key improvements.

The blade width is less than on most antique examples. This is for improved leverage - handle length relative to blade width. The blade thickness is 3/8" for adequate strength. The bevel angle of 30° is ideal for both soft and hard woods.

Common Froes were typically made from one piece of steel, bent into a loop at one end to form a ferrule to receive the handle. However, the uneven shape of the ferrule made it difficult to secure a hand-carved handle            that wouldn’t work loose over time. Our Froe blades are welded to a cylindrical ferrule and have a            tight-fitting, turned handle secured with a stepped washer and large lag screw. They are built for longevity and durability.
Lie-Nielsen Froes are finished in a tough, baked powder black enamel. Handles are kiln-dried ash.

products.name: No. 4-1/2 Smooth Plane
descriptions: Solidly built, this is the ultimate smoothing plane. It is longer, wider, and heavier than the No. 4, and its extra thick blade eliminates the possibility of chatter. Only available in Ductile Iron.

products.name: No. 5 Jack Plane
descriptions: Jack Planes excel at a large variety of tasks, such as removing milling marks or the scallops of a scrub plane. The No. 5 is built for hard work and will quickly flatten surfaces for the finer set planes to follow.

products.name: No. 5-1/2 Jack Plane
descriptions: The heaviest of the Jack Planes, the No. 5½ is comfortable and superbly balanced. It is as wide as the No. 7 Jointer but only two-thirds the length. Ideal for truing wider boards.

products.name: No. 6 Fore Plane
descriptions: Sized midway between a Jack and a Jointer, the No. 6 Fore Plane is designed to further true the surface after the Jack has sized it. Its length enables it to skim off high spots as it bridges low spots, delivering a leveled surface ready for the smoothing plane.

products.name: No. 7 Jointer Plane
descriptions: Our most popular jointer size, excellent for trueing and shooting accurate joints.

products.name: Large Router Plane -  Open Throat
descriptions: Router Planes are essential for any work that requires precise depth cuts, such as mortises, tenons, hinge gains, inlay, door locks, and the like.

Loosely based on the Stanley No. 71, our Large Router Planes feature an improved Brass depth stop and Stainless Steel blade adjuster for precise control of cutting depth. The included fence can be mounted on either side of the blade and flipped around for straight or curved cuts.

We make both Open and Closed throat versions of our Large Router Planes. The Open Throat design offers more visibility in front of the tool, which is especially useful for inlay work. The Closed Throat design gives more support in front of the blade, making it ideal for working on the edges of boards or cleaning out the end of a stopped groove in a rail or stile.

Our Router Planes have square blades, held solidly in square broached holes. This prevents the blade from slipping or twisting when removing large shavings or during diagonal use. The blade can also be mounted to face the back of the plane to work closer into corners.

products.name: Low Angle Smoothing Plane Blade, Toothed
descriptions: Toothed blades have small chisel-like teeth .030" (.762mm) wide, and spaced .030" apart. They are used for heavy stock removal in difficult grain. Follow with a fine-set Smoothing Plane.

Please Note: Toothed blades are great for quick, heavy stock removal. However, something like a knot in pine can break the teeth so be careful around difficult spots. We recommend that you hone your toothed blade with a secondary bevel at of 30 degrees or higher depending on the type of wood you are planing.

products.name: No. 95 Bronze Edge Plane
descriptions: This plane is an adaptation of the Stanley No. 95, a specialty plane not made for many years. It has an integral 90 degree fence, making its primary use trimming edge stock square. With appropriate angle blocks, it can produce various angles or widen dadoes and rabbets to depth. The fence, coupled with a low angled blade, makes these jobs simple and precise, working either with or across the grain, or in plywoods. This plane also makes an effective small jointer when used with a straight edge clamped to the work.

The body is cast Manganese Bronze, a hard and durable alloy that gives welcome heft to this small plane. Each tool is carefully polished to a mirror finish. Our lever adjustment moves the blade with almost zero backlash, making adjustment positive and exceptionally smooth.

products.name: 50 Degree Frog for No. 4 & 5 Bench Planes
descriptions: Until now, all Stanley-type bench plane irons were bedded at 45°, or Common Pitch. But the famous English Smoothers like Norris are usually 50° (York Pitch) or 55° (Middle Pitch). The higher pitches make smoothing difficult wood easier. York Pitch will handle most tear-out prone wood well. Middle Pitch is for the most difficult woods.
These unique High Angle Frogs quickly convert our bench planes (No.3 - No.7) to York Pitch. Will not fit other makes of planes.

products.name: Small Scraping Plane Blade, 25tpi Toothed
descriptions: Toothed blades for our No. 212 Small Scraping Plane, useful for preparing surfaces for veneering and for working exceptionally difficult grains.
Available in 18 and 25 teeth per inch.

products.name: Rabbeting Iron Blank, 1"
descriptions: Rabbeting Plane Iron Blanks (O1 Tool Steel, unhardened), with the tang centered, are for creating traditional rabbeting planes. All are 8" (20.32cm) long, have a bit length of 2-3/16" (5.55cm) and are tapered from 1/8" (3.17mm) to 1/16" (1.58mm) over the total length of the blade.

products.name: Tapered Dovetail Saw
descriptions: We believe that our Back Saws are the finest made anywhere. They are based on a British saw made in 1830. Owning one is like having a piece of woodworking history in your shop.

Since dovetailing is a ripping operation, where the kerf runs with the grain, our Dovetail Saws have teeth filed to a rip profile. Solid milled Brass back, finest quality Swedish Steel blade, Cherry handle and traditional Brass split nut saw bolts.

The tapered version of our Dovetail Saw features a slight tapering of the blade from toe to heel. This taper gives you better control over precise cuts. When you reach the gauge line on the front of your stock, the blade is slightly above the line on the back side, which reduces the risk of sawing past your line. In addition, the taper introduces an angled approach to your stock (when holding the saw back parallel to the bench), enabling faster cuts with less effort.
Read a review by Lost Art Press of

products.name: 45 Degree Frog for No. 4 & 5 Bench Planes
descriptions: These Standard Angle Replacement Frogs fit our Bench Planes.

products.name: 3/16" Mortise Chisel
descriptions: Designed with cabinetmaking in mind, not timber framing, these well-balanced Mortise Chisels are ground with parallel sides and are taller than they are wide to help keep them straight in the cut.

products.name: 5/16" Mortise Chisel
descriptions: Designed with cabinetmaking in mind, not timber framing, these well-balanced Mortise Chisels are ground with parallel sides and are taller than they are wide to help keep them straight in the cut.

products.name: Hardened A2 Steel Cross Peen Hammer
descriptions: These small hammers are not only great for tacks and brads, but also for making fine blade adjustments on your planes. Hickory handles.
As with all wood, which is an organic material, there are color variations between different handles.  Some handles are naturally lighter or darker than others.

products.name: Standard Dowel Plate
descriptions: Use a Dowel Plate to easily make exact-sized dowels from anywood you choose. Also useful for making precise tenons on chairspindles. 5-1/8" long x 1½" wide x ¼" thick, made from surfaceground A2 Tool Steel, hardened to 60 RC.

Holes are machined with a 6° clearance taper on the underside. Holes are straight for the first .045", allowing you to sharpen them without affecting the hole size. Start with pieceswhittled close to your desired diameter, chamfered at theleading end, and hammer it through the appropriate holefor perfectly sized dowels. Includes two mounting holes forNo. 10 flat head screws.
Standard Dowel Plate makes 1/8", 3/16", ¼", 5/16", 3/8", ½",5/8" dowels.
Metric Dowel Plate makes 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12and 16mm dowels.

products.name: Metric Dowel Plate
descriptions: Use a Dowel Plate to easily make exact-sized dowels from anywood you choose. Also useful for making precise tenons on chairspindles. 5-1/8" long x 1½" wide x ¼" thick, made from surfaceground A2 Tool Steel, hardened to 60 RC.

Holes are machined with a 6° clearance taper on the underside. Holes are straight for the first .045", allowing you to sharpen them without affecting the hole size. Start with pieceswhittled close to your desired diameter, chamfered at theleading end, and hammer it through the appropriate holefor perfectly sized dowels. Includes two mounting holes forNo. 10 flat head screws.
Standard Dowel Plate makes 1/8", 3/16", ¼", 5/16", 3/8", ½",5/8" dowels.
Metric Dowel Plate makes 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12and 16mm dowels.

products.name: SD-2 Split Nut Screwdriver
descriptions: This screwdriver is made to fit the split nuts on our open saw handles (Dovetail and Carcass Saws). Modeled after gunsmith's screwdrivers with machined tips, correctly sized to fit the screw slots, giving you good power and control, without slipping. Blade is hardened 416 Stainless Steel. Cherry handles.

products.name: SD-3 Tenon Saw Nut Screwdriver
descriptions: This screwdrivers is made to fit the bolts on our closed handled saws (Tenon and Panel Saws) as well as the Inlay Thicknessing Gauge. They may be useful for other jobs as well. Modeled after gunsmith's screwdrivers with machined tips, correctly sized to fit the screw slots, giving you good power and control, without slipping. Blades are hardened 416 Stainless Steel. Cherry handles.

products.name: No. 62 Low Angle Jack Plane Blade, Toothed
descriptions: Toothed blades have small chisel-like teeth .030" (.762mm) wide, and spaced .030" apart. They are used for heavy stock removal in difficult grain. Follow with a fine-set Smoothing Plane.

Please Note: Toothed blades are great for quick, heavy stock removal. However, something like a knot in pine can break the teeth so be careful around difficult spots. We recommend that you hone your toothed blade with a secondary bevel of 30 degrees or higher depending on the type of wood you are planing.

products.name: Small Router Plane Blade, 1/4" Pointed
descriptions: For use in our No. 271 Small Router Planes. Made from O1 Tool Steel. The Small Router Plane comes with a 1/4" wide square tip blade.
Three specialty blades designed for inlay work are also available:

products.name: Rabbeting Plane Iron Blank, 7/8"
descriptions: Rabbeting Plane Iron Blanks (O1 Tool Steel, unhardened), with the tang centered, are for creating traditional rabbeting planes. All are 8" (20.32cm) long, have a bit length of 2-3/16" (5.55cm) and are tapered from 1/8" (3.17mm) to 1/16" (1.58mm) over the total length of the blade.

products.name: Tenon Saw
descriptions: A Tenon Saw is a large backsaw used for making deep, accurate cuts in furniture joinery. It should make straight, fast cuts without binding. Based on a classic Henry Disston model from the early 20th century, this Tenon Saw has a Cherry handle, Brass fittings, and a stout ¾" x ¼" milled Brass back. These saws are solid, well balanced and smooth cutting. Filed rip for cutting tenons, which is with the grain.

products.name: SD-4 Chipbreaker Screwdriver
descriptions: This screwdriver is made to fit the chip breaker screw on our bench planes.  It may be useful for other jobs as well. Modeled after gunsmith's screwdrivers with machined tips, correctly sized to fit the screw slots, giving you good power and control, without slipping. Hardened 416 Stainless Steel blade. Cherry handle.

products.name: SD-5 Handle Nut/Cap Screwdriver
descriptions: This screwdriver is made to fit the handle nuts (except the #1) and cap screws on our tools. It may be useful for other jobs as well. Modeled after gunsmith's screwdrivers with machined tips, correctly sized to fit the screw slots, giving you good power and control, without slipping. Blade is hardened 416 Stainless Steel. Cherry handle.

products.name: SD-6 Skew Block Plane Screwdriver
descriptions: This screwdriver is made to fit the fence and side plate locking screws on our Low Angle Skew Block Planes. It also fits the cap screw on our No. 60-1/2 Block Plane.  Modeled after gunsmith's screwdrivers with machined tips, correctly sized to fit the screw slots, giving you good power and control, without slipping. Blade is hardened 416 Stainless Steel. Cherry handle.

products.name: SD-7 Frog Adjuster Screwdriver
descriptions: This screwdriver is made to fit the frog adjuster screws on our bench planes. It may be useful for other jobs as well. Modeled after gunsmith's screwdrivers with machined tips, correctly sized to fit the screw slots, giving you good power and control, without slipping. Blade is hardened 416 Stainless Steel. Cherry handle.

products.name: No. 62 Low Angle Jack Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 62 Low Angle Jack Plane. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.

products.name: Cabinet Maker's Scraping Plane Blade, 25tpi Toothed
descriptions: Toothed blades for our No. 85 Cabinet Maker's Scraper, useful for preparing surfaces for veneering and for working exceptionally difficult grains.
Available in 18 and 25 teeth per inch.

products.name: Straight Drawknife
descriptions: Based on an antique Witherby design, available in two different styles: one with a slightly forward and downward curvature to the blade (like the original), and the other with a straight blade. Relief milled in the back for ease of sharpening.

Handles are positioned so the Drawknife can be used in both bevel up and bevel down positions. If your preference is to use the Drawknife exclusively in the bevel up or bevel down positions, the handles may be bent to achieve the optimum angle in relationship to the blade. Flat ground 25° bevel.

products.name: SD-8 Handle Toe Screwdriver
descriptions: This screwdriver is made to fit the toe screw on our tool handles. It may be useful for other jobs as well. Modeled after gunsmith's screwdrivers with machined tips, correctly sized to fit the screw slots, giving you good power and control, without slipping. Blade is hardened 416 Stainless Steel. Cherry handles.

products.name: SD-9 Honing Guide Screwdriver
descriptions: This screwdriver is made to fit the captive screws in the removable jaws for our Honing Guide. It may be useful for other jobs as well. Modeled after gunsmith's screwdrivers with machined tips, correctly sized to fit the screw slots, giving you good power and control, without slipping. Blade is hardened 416 Stainless Steel. Cherry handle.

products.name: SD-10 3/16" Phillips Screwdriver
descriptions: This screwdriver is made to fit the nicker screws on our No. 60-1/2 Rabbet Block Plane, No. 140 Skew Block Plane, No. 10-1/4 Bench Rabbet Plane, and No. 610 Low Angle Rabbet Plane.
Screwdriver bit is hardened 4140 Steel.  Cherry handle, Brass ferrule.
Overall length is approximately 5-1/4."

products.name: 1/2" Double Bevel Mortise Blades
descriptions: For use with Tite-Mark and Tite-Mark Long. Available in 1/4", 5/16", 3/8" and 1/2".
Precisely made by Glen-Drake Toolworks in California.

products.name: 1/4" Double Bevel Mortise Blade
descriptions: For use with Tite-Mark and Tite-Mark Long. Available in 1/4", 5/16", 3/8" and 1/2".
Precisely made by Glen-Drake Toolworks in California.

products.name: 3/8" Double Bevel Mortise Blades
descriptions: For use with Tite-Mark and Tite-Mark Long. Available in 1/4", 5/16", 3/8" and 1/2".
Precisely made by Glen-Drake Toolworks in California.

products.name: 5/16" Double Bevel Mortise Blades
descriptions: For use with Tite-Mark and Tite-Mark Long. Available in 1/4", 5/16", 3/8" and 1/2".
Precisely made by Glen-Drake Toolworks in California.

products.name: No. 212 Small Scraping Plane, Bronze
descriptions: This unusual plane is based on the now scarce Stanley No. 212, which was discontinued in 1934 and brings high prices from today’s collectors. We are pleased to make it available for woodworkers once again.

The almost perpendicular blade makes it ideal for small scraping jobs, producing shavings like the finest lace and leaving smooth surfaces with crisp edges. The blade angle can be adjusted from 75° to 100°, enabling it to be set up just right for the particular wood being worked.

products.name: Dovetail Saw
descriptions: We believe that our Back Saws are the finest made anywhere. They are based on a British saw made in 1830. Owning one is like having a piece of woodworking history in your shop.

Since dovetailing is a ripping operation, where the kerf is running with the grain, our Dovetail Saw has its teeth filed to a rip profile. Solid milled Brass back, finest quality Swedish Steel blade, Cherry handle and traditional Brass split nut saw bolts.
With 15 points per inch, this Saw strikes an ideal balance between surface finish and speed. Teeth are set at .003" per side for a .026" kerf — narrow to help you cut straight.

products.name: Small Router Plane Blade, 3/32" Pointed
descriptions: For use in our No. 271 Small Router Planes. Made from O1 Tool Steel. The Small Router Plane comes with a 1/4" wide square tip blade.
Three specialty blades designed for inlay work are also available:

products.name: Molding Plane Iron Blank, 2"
descriptions: Made of annealed AISI O1 tool steel. The Tapered Molding Plane Iron Blanks offered are designed to cover all the widths necessary to create a full set of Hollows and Rounds. All are 8" (20.32cm) long, have a bit length of 2-3/16" (5.55cm) and are tapered from 1/8" (3.17mm) to 1/16" (1.58mm) over the total length of the blade.

products.name: Small Froe
descriptions: Froes are L-shaped tools used in combination with mallets and wedges to rive green wood along the grain with more precision and finesse than an axe or maul. They are used to make planks, chair parts, tool handles, shingles, basket splints, blanks for spoon carving, and more.

Common Froes were typically made from one piece of steel, bent into a loop at one end to form a ferrule to receive the handle. However, the uneven shape of the ferrule made it difficult to secure a hand-carved handle that wouldn’t work loose over time. Our Froe blades are welded to a cylindrical ferrule and have a tight-fitting, turned handle secured with a stepped washer and large lag screw. They are built for longevity and durability.
Lie-Nielsen Froes are finished in a tough, baked powder black enamel. Handles are kiln-dried ash.

products.name: Large Tongue and Groove Plane Blade
descriptions: For use in our No. 48 Tongue & Groove Plane. Centers on ¾" stock, leaving a ¼" wide tongue and .3125" deep grooves. On narrower or wider boards, the tongue will be offset from center, but still hidden within the joint.

products.name: Small Scraping Plane Blade, 18tpi Toothed
descriptions: Toothed blades for our No. 212 Small Scraping Plane, useful for preparing surfaces for veneering and for working exceptionally difficult grains.
Available in 18 and 25 teeth per inch.

products.name: 1/2" Mortise Chisel
descriptions: Designed with cabinetmaking in mind, not timber framing, these well-balanced Mortise Chisels are ground with parallel sides and are taller than they are wide to help keep them straight in the cut.

products.name: Large Scraping Plane Blade, 25tpi Toothed
descriptions: Toothed blades for our No. 112 Large Scraping Plane, useful for preparing surfaces for veneering and for working exceptionally difficult grains.
Available in 18 and 25 teeth per inch.

products.name: Cabinet Maker's Scraper Plane Blade, 18tpi Toothed
descriptions: Toothed blades for our No. 85 Cabinet Maker's Scraper, useful for preparing surfaces for veneering and for working exceptionally difficult grains.
Available in 18 and 25 teeth per inch.

products.name: Small Tongue and Groove Plane Blade
descriptions: For use in our No. 49 Tongue & Groove Plane. Centers on 1/2" stock, leaving a .166" wide tongue and .230" deep grooves. On narrower or wider boards, the tongue will be offset from center, but still hidden within the joint.

products.name: Rabbeting Plane Iron Blank, 5/8"
descriptions: Rabbeting Plane Iron Blanks (O1 Tool Steel, unhardened), with the tang centered, are for creating traditional rabbeting planes. All are 8" (20.32cm) long, have a bit length of 2-3/16" (5.55cm) and are tapered from 1/8" (3.17mm) to 1/16" (1.58mm) over the total length of the blade.

products.name: Curved Drawknife
descriptions: Based on an antique Witherby design, available in two different styles: one with a slightly forward and downward curvature to the blade (like the original), and the other with a straight blade. Relief milled in the back for ease of sharpening.

Handles are positioned so the Drawknife can be used in both bevel up and bevel down positions. If your preference is to use the Drawknife exclusively in the bevel up or bevel down positions, the handles may be bent to achieve the optimum angle in relationship to the blade. Flat ground 25° bevel.

products.name: 55 Degree Frog for No. 4 & 5 Bench Planes
descriptions: Until now, all Stanley-type bench plane irons were bedded at 45°, or Common Pitch. But the famous English Smoothers like Norris are usually 50° (York Pitch) or 55° (Middle Pitch). The higher pitches make smoothing difficult wood easier. York Pitch will handle most tear-out prone wood well. Middle Pitch is for the most difficult woods.
These unique High Angle Frogs quickly convert our bench planes (No.3 - No.7) to Middle Pitch (55º). Will not fit other makes of planes.

products.name: Tapered Tenon Saw
descriptions: A Tenon Saw is a large backsaw used for making deep, accurate cuts in furniture joinery. It should make straight, fast cuts without binding. Based on a classic Henry Disston model from the early 20th century, this Tenon Saw has a Cherry handle, Brass fittings, and a stout ¾" x ¼" milled Brass back. These saws are solid, well balanced and smooth cutting. Filed rip for cutting tenons, which is with the grain.

We’ve redesigned our three most popular back saws to feature a slight tapering of the blade from toe to heel. This taper gives you better control over precise cuts. When you reach the gauge line on the front of your stock, the blade is slightly above the line on the back side, which reduces the risk of sawing past your line. In addition, the taper introduces an angled approach to your stock (when holding the saw back parallel to the bench), enabling faster cuts with less effort.
Our Tapered Tenon Saw is similar to our 16" Tenon Saw but with a 3/8" taper along the length of the blade and a thinner saw plate.
Read a review by Lost Art Press of

products.name: Small Router Plane Blade, 3/32" Square
descriptions: For use in our No. 271 Small Router Planes. Made from O1 Tool Steel. The Small Router Plane comes with a 1/4" wide square tip blade.
Three specialty blades designed for inlay work are also available:

products.name: Tapered Carcass Saw
descriptions: We’ve redesigned our three most popular back saws to feature a slight tapering of the blade from toe to heel. This taper gives you better control over precise cuts. When you reach the gauge line on the front of your stock, the blade is slightly above the line on the back side, which reduces the risk of sawing past your line. In addition, the taper introduces an angled approach to your stock (when holding the saw back parallel to the bench), enabling faster cuts with less effort.
Our Tapered Carcass Saw is patterned after our 14" Carcass Saw with a thinner plate of .015".

It tapers ¼" along the length of the blade, with a cutting depth of 2" at the toe and 2-1/4" at the heel. This combination of features yields a well-balanced saw that cuts extremely fast and precisely, with excellent surface finish.
Read a review by Lost Art Press of

products.name: No. 102 Block Plane Blade, Toothed
descriptions: Replacement blade for our No. 102 or No. 103 Block Planes. Comes with a 25° flat ground bevel.
Toothed blades have small chisel-like teeth .030" (.762mm) wide, and spaced .030" apart. They are used for heavy stock removal in difficult grain. Follow with a fine-set Smoothing Plane.

Please Note: Toothed blades are great for quick, heavy stock removal. However, something like a knot in pine can break the teeth so be careful around difficult spots. We recommend that you hone your toothed blade with a secondary bevel at of 30 degrees or higher depending on the type of wood you are planing.

products.name: Large Scraping Plane Blade, 18tpi Toothed
descriptions: Toothed blades for our No. 112 Large Scraping Plane, useful for preparing surfaces for veneering and for working exceptionally difficult grains.
Available in 18 and 25 teeth per inch.

products.name: Mortise Chisel Handle (Maple)
descriptions: Slightly larger in diameter and length than our Standard Chisel Handle, the Mortise Chisel Handle ships with our Mortise, 7/8" and 1" Bevel Edge, and 1/2" Corner Chisels. Made of Hard Maple.

products.name: No. 212 Small Scraping Plane, Iron
descriptions: This unusual plane is based on the now scarce Stanley No. 212, which was discontinued in 1934 and brings high prices from today’s collectors. We are pleased to make it available for woodworkers once again.

The almost perpendicular blade makes it ideal for small scraping jobs, producing shavings like the finest lace and leaving smooth surfaces with crisp edges. The blade angle can be adjusted from 75° to 100°, enabling it to be set up just right for the particular wood being worked.

products.name: Carcass Saw
descriptions: The Carcass Saw is used for precise cuts across the grain, cutting tenon shoulders, and defining the edges of a dado. An ideal complement to the Dovetail Saw.
It has 14 points per inch, filed crosscut, for cutting quickly, yet accurately and smoothly.

products.name: Small Router Plane Blade, 1/4" Square
descriptions: For use in our No. 271 Small Router Planes. Made from O1 Tool Steel. The Small Router Plane comes with a 1/4" wide square tip blade.
Three specialty blades designed for inlay work are also available:

products.name: Rabbeting Plane Iron Blank, 2"
descriptions: Rabbeting Plane Iron Blanks (O1 Tool Steel, unhardened), with the tang centered, are for creating traditional rabbeting planes. All are 8" (20.32cm) long, have a bit length of 2-3/16" (5.55cm) and are tapered from 1/8" (3.17mm) to 1/16" (1.58mm) over the total length of the blade.

products.name: Convex Sole Block Plane
descriptions: This small block plane is perfect for all sorts of hollowing jobs like chair seats, moldings and model making. The sole of the plane is 1-1/4" wide x 3-1/2" long. Overall length, including the squirrel-tail handle, is 4-7/8". The sole has a convex radius of 3" in the width and 27" in the length.
Ductile Iron body, Bronze cap.

products.name: Bench Rabbet Plane Blade
descriptions: Replacement blade for Lie-Nielsen No. 10-1/4 Bench Rabbet Plane. A2 Steel, Cryogenically treated, hardened to Rockwell 60-62 and double tempered. Our heat treating technique ensures that the blade will take and hold a very fine edge for a long time. After heat treating, the blade is fully surface ground on the top, back, and cutting edge, giving a smooth, flat surface that will take a mirror finish very quickly. Our blades are thick to provide solid, chatter-free cutting.
